archetype_name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
name: Quinoa-Chickpea Stuffed Peppers with Lemon-Herb Arugula Salad
description: Oven-baked bell peppers filled with a lemony quinoa, chickpea, and herb mixture, served with a bright arugula-cucumber side. Light, high-fiber, and family-friendly with mild Mediterranean spices.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup quinoa under cold water in a fine strainer.
Bring 2 cups vegetable stock to a simmer in a small pot.
Drain and rinse chickpeas if using cooked from a can; measure 2 cups chickpeas.
Halve 4 bell peppers lengthwise and remove seeds/cores; set in a baking dish cut-side up.
Finely chop 1 small red onion and 2 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup parsley and 2 tablespoons mint.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; keep separate.
Slice 1 large cucumber into half-moons; set 4 cups arugula in a bowl.
cook_steps: Add rinsed quinoa to the simmering vegetable stock, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until fluffy, 12–15 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
While quinoa cooks, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a skillet over medium. Soften red onion for 3–4 minutes, then add garlic for 30 seconds.

In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, sautéed onion/garlic, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, parsley, mint, lemon zest, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Stir in 1 teaspoon sumac and 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Lightly brush the cut edges of bell peppers with 1 teaspoon olive oil and a pinch of salt. Spoon the quinoa mixture into each pepper half, packing gently.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake 5 more minutes until peppers are tender but hold shape.
Make the salad: toss arugula and cucumber with 2 teaspoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Serve 2 stuffed pepper halves per person with a side of the arugula-cucumber salad. Optional: sprinkle a pinch of sumac on top for brightness.
